intro: Eulophia lubbersiana, commonly known as the Lüders' eulophia, is a tropical orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its upright, slender growth habit and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically has a single, short stem with a few sheaths and can bear several flower spikes. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb moisture from the humid environment. Eulophia lubbersiana thrives in shaded, moist habitats and is often found in forest understories.
